keyword: how many calories are in cum
title: How Many Calories Are in Cum?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in cum (semen), including protein, carbs, fat, and other nutrients per average ejaculation, with quick facts and variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Cum?
assumptions: Average male ejaculation volume (~3-5 ml); composition based on typical human semen (water, fructose, proteins, minerals); no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by individual health, diet, hydration, and volume; values are approximate. Consult medical sources for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One average ejaculation of cum contains about 15 kcal, with trace protein and sugars.

label_note: Values mirror simplified Nutrition Facts for comparison; semen is not a typical food source.

tweaks.label: Higher volume ejaculation (5 ml vs. 3 ml average)

faqs.q: How many calories are in one ejaculation of cum?
faqs.a: Approximately 15 kcal for an average 3-5 ml volume.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in cum besides calories?
faqs.a: Trace amounts: ~0.5 g protein, 2.5 g carbs (mostly sugars), 0.3 g fat, and minerals like sodium (~30 mg).
Yes, but minimalâ€”about 0.5 g per average ejaculation from enzymes and sperm proteins.

faqs.q: How does volume affect calories in cum?
faqs.a: Larger volumes (e.g., 5 ml) can have up to 25 kcal; smaller ones around 5-10 kcal.

faqs.q: Is cum a significant source of nutrition?
faqs.a: No, it's mostly water (90%+) with negligible calories and nutrients compared to food.
